title: The toxicity of this community astounds me.
body:
5 games tonight. All 5 I was flamed and screamed at for minuscule things. 2 ranked, 3 norms. I love this game, and I really love the art, design and lore behind all these characters. But this community really makes it hard to be proud to call myself a League player.

This is probably falling on deaf ears. Not sure if Riot needs to change the way their tribunal works or what have you. I’m not even sure if this is anyone’s fault.

But please guys, if it doesn’t contribute to the game and you wouldn’t want to hear it said to you; don’t type it. Mute others, don’t engage. Let’s try and clean up our acts. I’ve been guilty of saying hurtful things too, but we all live and learn. 

Let’s grow. Together.

Bullying, is bullying. Whether it happens at school or it happens online. My 8 year old daughter who is gifted in the areas of reading and writing, as in she has had specific identifications through the gifted services department and psychological evaluations that has put her IQ right around 140, suffers tremendously from bullying because she is "different" than her peers. She has come home crying on multiple occasions because of things people have SAID to her. Words have power behind them, no matter how much you sit there and tell yourself "its just the internet" bullying other people is wrong, period!

There are wrongs you can do something about, and then there are wrong where you're just being whiny. You're not going to change the internet, riot isn't going to change the internet. If you avoid everywhere people might be mean to you, and then bitch like they have some moral obligation to change, and play the victim, then you're just being weak. 

Someone in a random league match you've never seen before, and will likely never see again tells you you should kill yourself? Who... gives... a shit...

Take responsibility for your own mental, and move on. Shit could not mean less. Saying "Well at least im better a person than them" is something you tell yourself, not a justification for pushing for society to change. It isn't going to.

And there it is. "I should be able to do whatever I want without consequences. IM not wrong, you are just whiny." That's the attitude that causes the toxic behavior right there. Communities, even this one, should have rules, they should be enforced, and people should change. Maybe they wont change, but they should be banned if they don't. That's life.

Excuse me you not quite so informed sir, did you know that Science has indeed concluded that words can indeed cause physiological damages which can if taken far enough even result in physical complications?

 
Human brains works that way, its not about "being tough" or "sensitive" its outright hardwired in our brains to react to be ill affected by insults, being put down, looked down on and etc.

And humans are not logical, the victim could look at the person who is for example, hurling the insults at the victim and recognize that they are just out to cause misery and conclude that its all naught but shit however the brain doesnt play that nicely.


Humans are social creatures who normally cant help but think about the input from the people in their surroundings, so a continuous or repeated set of insults will actually end up having effect almost regardless of what one might do or think.


Of course its possible to learn to filter that out, however its not something everyone can do, nor something everyone has actually had to learn.--.-.......or something they actually should have to learn.


That´s why there are laws and rules against degrading and insulting others, because a handful of words can result in irreversible consequences when directed towards the wrong person.


Some people can get say take a severe wound to the chest or back and die almost instantly from the pain induced chock, others wont have such a severe reaction and will instead be fine if they get treated in time, a seemingly minor difference on paper with quite the difference in results. 

People are like paper? No, people are different and that´s why one has to be careful.

-------

Now  in my opinion one shouldn't take the written words read online seriously, however because humans are as we are its necessary to try and keep ourselves from thinking that such behavior is harmless because at some point it might not be and then it´ll be too late to feel sorry about it.   

So we cant just ignore the ill mannered and the toxic, because if people realized that being polite or quiet even are both doable and at no cost at all  our environments would be so much better with almost no effort at all.
